name: el3v
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0
body: -| wi(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), universe), wcel(cv(s1), universe), wcel(cv(s2), universe)), w0)

stmt.origin: mp3an(w0, wcel(cv(s0), universe), wcel(cv(s1), universe), wcel(cv(s2), universe))
stmt.pretty: mp3an(w0, s0 ∈ 𝕌, s1 ∈ 𝕌, s2 ∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- w0
-| wcel(cv(s0), universe)
-| wcel(cv(s1), universe)
-| wcel(cv(s2), universe)
-| wi(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), universe), wcel(cv(s1), universe), wcel(cv(s2), universe)), w0)

comment: New way ( ~ elv , and the theorems beginning with "el2v" or "el3v") to shorten some proofs. Inference forms (with ` |- A e. _V ` , ` |- B e. _V ` and ` |- C e. _V ` hypotheses) of the general theorems (proving ` |- ( ( A e. V /\ B e. W /\ C e. X ) -> ` assertions) may be superfluous. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 13-Oct-2018.)
